title: European migrant crisis
summary: The European migrant crisis, also known as the European refugee crisis, is a period of significantly increased movement of refugees and migrants into Europe since 2011. The term is often used to refer specifically to the year 2015, when 1.3 million people came to Europe to request asylum,[2] the highest number since World War II.[3] Those requesting asylum in Europe in 2015 were mostly Syrians,[4] but also included significant numbers of Afghans, Nigerians, Pakistanis, Iraqis and Eritreans.[5]
